intro: Colchicum bulbocodium var. edentatum, commonly known as the edentate autumn crocus, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant produces bulbous structures known as corms, which serve as storage organs for nutrients. Its leaves are broad and arrow-shaped, emerging from the base of the plant. The species is valued for its ornamental beauty and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
